com.geolud.atomica.objects

Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.geolud.atomica.objects.Level
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class Level
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Represents the level a game can be in. It is defined by a number of allowed colors, a final score for reaching the next level and a level number.
    Author:
    Georg Ludewig
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MAX_NUMBEROFCOLORS
      The maximum number of colors a level can have.
      static int MAX_SCORE
      The maximum score the final score be assigned to.
      static int MIN_NUMBEROFCOLORS
      The minimum number of colors a level can have.
      static int MIN_SCORE
      The minimum score the final score be assigned to.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Level(int levelNumber, int finalScore, int numberOfColors)
      Creates a level with the given number, the score to reach the next level and the number of colors which can appear when playing this level.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getLevelNumber()
      Returns the number of the level.

      Returns the level number of the level.

      Sets the final score required to reach the next level.
